text.p: These are the leading stories in the Algerian press on Monday as reported by the official Algerian news agency APS. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Government officials and political parties' leaders pursue campaign for referendum to change the constitution.
- Preparations for a huge turnout in the constitutional referendum on November 28.
- Oilworkers union continue negotiations with Sonatrach over pay increase. The union will decide today whether to strike.
- Algerian Human Rights League appeals for end to violence.
- Armed "terrorist" groups infiltrate the Algerian border with Morocco.
- Former prime minister Mouloud Hamrouche says his National Liberation Front party's programme does not represent the movement's grassroots.
